m_szDocSumamry: Comparing Batteries and Fuel Cells as Replacements for Gasoline By Paul Ausick February 1, 2016 8:35 am EST Tweet As a transportation fuel, liquid hydrocarbon fuel (gasoline, diesel, etc.) is hard to beat. It’s relatively stable, relatively easy to transport and, most importantly, benefits from a global infrastructure to find it, develop it, refine it and ship it to consumers. Displacing liquid hydrocarbons will take decades, and there are currently two contenders for job: batteries and fuel cells.
